skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: 92Bilal26

security_audit.summary: This is a skill development toolkit containing Python helper scripts for creating, validating, and packaging Claude skills. All 110 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation references to script names (e.g., 'convert_pdf_to_images.py' containing 'md5' substring), Apache 2.0 license text, and standard Python library imports. The skill performs only local file operations for skill initialization and packaging.

content.value_statement: Claude skills need specialized structure to work effectively. This skill provides a proven framework for creating, validating, and packaging skills that extend Claude with domain knowledge, workflows, and tool integrations.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill directories with proper structure
Validate skill format and YAML frontmatter requirements
Package skills into distributable zip files
Create bundled resources including scripts, references, and assets
Apply progressive disclosure design for context-efficient skills
limitations: Does not execute skill code - only creates structure
Does not validate skill content quality beyond format
No network connectivity or external API calls
Requires manual editing of SKILL.md for content

use_cases.title: Build domain expertise skills
use_cases.description: Package company policies, API docs, or technical guides into reusable skills for consistent AI responses.

use_cases.title: Create workflow automation skills
use_cases.description: Bundle scripts and procedures for deployment pipelines, database operations, or cloud resource management.

use_cases.title: Develop task-specific toolsets
use_cases.description: Create skills with templates, references, and assets for common tasks like document creation or data analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new Claude skill project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] at path [path] for [describe purpose]. Include scripts for [specific operations if needed].

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Run validation on my skill at [path] to verify SKILL.md has proper frontmatter and required fields.

prompt_templates.title: Package for distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [path] into a zip file for distribution to users.

prompt_templates.title: Iterate on existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill at [path] and suggest improvements to SKILL.md, bundled resources, or overall structure.

output_examples.input: Create a new skill called pdf-helper at skills/public for working with PDF files. It should help merge, split, and extract text from PDFs.
output: Created scripts/ with example Python helper
Package when ready: python scripts/package_skill.py skills/public/pdf-helper
Skill is valid and ready for packaging

output_examples.input: Package my brand-guidelines skill for distribution

best_practices: Start with concrete usage examples before defining skill structure
Keep SKILL.md lean under 5k words - move detailed docs to references/
Use scripts/ for deterministic operations that get reused across requests
anti_patterns: Avoid putting all documentation in SKILL.md - use references/ for depth
Do not skip validation before packaging - catches format errors early
Avoid generic skill descriptions - be specific about when to use the skill

faq.question: What is a Claude skill?
faq.answer: A skill is a modular package that extends Claude with specialized knowledge, workflows, and tools for specific domains.

faq.question: Does this skill create executable code?
faq.answer: No - it creates skill structure and templates. Actual script execution requires separate implementation in the skill.

faq.question: Can I share packaged skills with others?
faq.answer: Yes - the package_skill.py script creates zip files that can be distributed and loaded by other Claude users.

faq.question: What goes in scripts/ vs references/ vs assets/?
faq.answer: Scripts contain executable code, references hold documentation for context, and assets store files used in output.

faq.question: How big can SKILL.md be?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 5k words for efficient loading. Move detailed docs to references/ for on-demand access.

faq.question: What validation does quick_validate.py perform?
faq.answer: It checks SKILL.md exists, validates YAML frontmatter format, verifies required name/description fields, and validates naming conventions.
